Key Match Events: South Africa's performance was timid and scarcely believable
Kagiso Rabada was carved through the offside first-ball by Stephan Myburgh
De Kock averages just 11.4 in T20I cricket against left-arm pace this year
Miller snatched at a pull, and Roelof van der Merwe snaffled a glorious catch
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa was expected to beat Netherlands, play the semi-final
The team had a powerful lineup, including Quinton de Kock, David Miller, and Rilee Rossouw
Post-Match Reflections: Temba Bavuma looked close to tears, and spoke directly about the 'chokers' tag
Bavuma said that the tag will always be there until they find themselves in a situation when they get to a final and come up on the right side of a result
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a knockout game, but South Africa's performance was disappointing
The team's history of World Cup exits has created a narrative that clouds sensible judgments of their actual merits
South Africa's fate at World Cup competitions is now a parole hearing, with anticipation, character development, rehabilitation, and hope
Others: The sun continued to burn bright in Adelaide, but it was just about after dawn back home in South Africa that their fate was sealed
